abstract: Tensions rise in city of Laredo, Tex, where growing number of Cuban immigrants easily enter United States while Central American asylum seekers fleeing violence are routinely denied entry; influx is spurred by change in Cuban policy allowing citizens to leave country without exit visas and 1966 US law that automatically admits any Cuban who sets foot on American soil.
lead_paragraph: More Cubans are entering the country under a law passed in 1966, creating a disparity at the border, where Central Americans are detained and sent to immigration court.

headline.main: Tension Simmers as Cubans Breeze Across U.S. Border
headline.print_headline: Tension Simmers as Cubans Breeze Across Border

snippet: More Cubans are entering the country under a law passed in 1966, creating a disparity at the border, where Central Americans are detained and sent to immigration court.
